cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.DL. 

The paper deals with document representation and information retrieval tasks, which are typically studied in the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-categories. The use of pairwise similarities to alter the word vector average representation suggests a machine learning approach, which is also relevant to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of neural networks, which is a common technique in the Deep Learning (cs.DL) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on network proximity and link prediction suggests a potential connection to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
